data.title: Archives: Search for "Oliver Platt"
data.text:

The Ice Harvest

Instead of an action comedy thatâs as slick as ice, Harold Ramisâ sardonic new comedy is more like an uncongealed river of slush.

Kill the Messenger

Jeremy Renner stars in this crusading-journalist story that recounts the downfall of real-life San Jose Mercury News reporter Gary Webb.

"...K. Williams, Tim Blake Nelson, Paz Vega, Michael Sheen, Oliver Platt, Andy Garcia, Yul Vazquez, Dan Futterman, Richard Schiff..."

The Oranges

The great ensemble cast is the highlight of this movie about a 50-year-old man who falls in love with his best friend's daughter, who is half his age.

"...Starring: Hugh Laurie, Catherine Keener, Leighton Meester, Allison Janney, Oliver Platt, Alia Shawcat, Adam Brody and Sam Rosen...."

TV Eye

The Big C offers a clear-eyed, sometimes comic look at cancer

"...is filled with overbearing men – her husband, Paul (Oliver Platt), who probably doesn't deserve her; her teenage son,..."

Peter Hedges' Pieces of April brings the novelist-screenwriter out of the quiet and into the filmmaking fray.

Please Give

Martian Child

Only in Hollywood can a movie about alien children be boring, although the terrific performances of John Cusack and Bobby Coleman help redeem this predictable mush.

"...Cusack, Bobby Coleman, Amanda Peet, Sophie Okonedo, Joan Cusack, Oliver Platt, Richard Schiff and Anjelica Huston. Only in Hollywood..."

A Thanksgiving from hell with the family and all the neighbors upstairs.

Simon Birch

The sincerity of its players, the level gaze of its camera, and a genuine affection for its story (suggested by John Irving's A Prayer for Owen Meany) keep this film afloat.
